article.headline: American 78, Colgate 59
article.story: WASHINGTON (AP)-- Raimondas Petrauskas scored a season-high 22 points, and Jason Thomas added 19 to lead American to a 78-59 win over Colgate Sunday. The Eagles (12-7, 5-2 Patriot League) needed a good performance from Petrauskas as forward Patrick Okpwae was suspended indefinitely because he missed curfew Friday night. Petrauskas, who shot 8-for-13 from the floor and grabbed seven rebounds, finished two points shy of a career high he set last season against Army. Jon Simon scored 19 points for Colgate (8-12, 3-4) which came within two points of erasing American's 41-28 halftime lead. Leading scorer Alvin Reed was held without a point in the first half, but scored eight during an 11-0 Raiders run that cut it to 41-39. However, Colgate's offense wasn't the same once Reed picked up his fourth foul with 15:35 to play. The Eagles, who held Colgate without a field goal during a five-minute stretch in the second half, also got a lift from Andre Ingram's 16 points. Ingram hit 6 of 12 shots, including three 3-pointers, which was a big improvement after shooting 1-for-13 from the floor in Friday night's win over Bucknell. American out-rebounded the Raiders 39-21 and shot 56 percent for the game. ^

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
